concept.title: Graph Visualization of DITA Content Using GraphViz
concept.shortdesc: The net.sf.dita4publishers.graphviz transform type provides a general framework for using the GraphViz tool to generate different node-and-arc graph visualizations of DITA content.

conbody.p: The GraphViz tool (http://graphviz.org) is an open-source node-and-arc graph layout and rendering tool that uses a simple data format ("DOT") as input. This data format is easy to generate from DITA content (or anything else from which a node-and-arc representation can be generated). fig.title: Generated index graph for the DITA for Publishers Users Guide

conbody.p: The net.sf.dita4publishers.graphviz Toolkit Plugin provides an XLST function package for creating the DOT data file and two graph generation options: a navigation tree graph and an index graph.

The graphviz transform type can be used as the base for other visualizations. Interesting visualizations might include task-to-task dependency graphs, relationship-table relationships, topic-to-topic dependencies based on cross references or content references, and so on.
The graphviz transformation type includes the Ant code needed to run the graphviz dot command-line tool to generate graphics from DOT data sets.
